Sequence Information.Peptide Name: PR-35 (a proline-arginine-rich peptide with 35 residues, cathelicidin, natural AMPs; pigs, mammals; animals; Pro-rich, PrAMPs)

Literature.Author: Jeon H, Thong LM, Ahn B, Cho HS, Van Chanh Quy L, Yum J, Hong K, Kim JH, Song H, Park C.2019
Literature.Title: Copy number variation of PR-39 cathelicidin, and identification of PR-35, a natural variant of PR-39 with reduced mammalian cytotoxicity.

Sequence Information.Comments: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of the peptide shows 89.7% similarity toPR-39.  Mol formula: C206H302N56O37; Mol Wt: 4155.03. GRAVY: -1.02.Activity:The antimicrobial activity of chemically synthesized PR-35 was similar to that of PR-39. Active against Gram- bacteria E. coli ATCC 25922 (MIC 3 ug/ml), S. typhimurium ATCC 14028 (MIC 2 ug/ml), P-aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC>32 ug/ml), S-aureus ATCC 25923, and B-cereus ATCC 10876 (MIC >32 ug/ml).Toxicity:  the level of mammalian cell cytotoxicity was lower than the wild type. Updated 7/2021
